website_summaries.verdict: A solid choice for consumers who have major trimming to do.
pros: Superior cutting ability compared to other options
Can cut through thicker branches easily where most other pruners would give in
cons: More expensive, but you are paying for quality construction and design

customer_reviews.title: Rusted.
customer_reviews.text: Already used it a handful of times and I love them! Update: please see pictures. After using them in my startup vegetable garden a handful of times. Why why?! I wanted to love them. Can’t return them too ugh Update: Cleaned then as the manufacturer recommended. After using them 2 times this week, they look even worst.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: SOOOO easy to hold and use!
customer_reviews.text: Over the years, I've grown exceeding tired of products sized for men's hands, men's arm and leg length, men's thigh length (can we talk deep sofas and chairs???) and on and on. What a great product this is! Easy to hold and fits my medium size hand (size 7 fingers if that helps) so well. BTW, also great mechanically. THANKS, FELCO, for recognizing there are women in the world, and they aren't just little men--particularly since we are likely the dominant gender in home gardening...my husband's idea of pruning is closer to bombing. ;)
customer_reviews.author: Movin' southTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Best pruner in the business for women's hands!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of this felco hand pruner ( only because my first ofter owning for 15 years got buried in a new apple orchard when I lost them from my pants pocket ) The ergonomics give me a strong cut and prevent my hand and thumbs from hurting after pruning 138 new apple trees. KUDOS for making an excellent product that is one of the few that stands the test of time. Additionally, these pruners really are great for smaller hands - I wish more tools for women had this thoughtful engineering.
customer_reviews.author: TheGirlFarmer

customer_reviews.title: The grip spring broke and fell off
customer_reviews.text: These were very expensive and I don't use them much. And yet the spring that bounces the blades back open after clipping, fell off. Now once you clip, the blades stay closed and I have to manually open them each time I clip something. Ridiculous. At this price, these should last forever without an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Oleander

customer_reviews.title: It those or nothing
customer_reviews.text: These pruners are perfect. Sharp, well made, I ordered a second pair since we been fighting who gets to use them in the yard. FGorget all the stuff you can buy in the Home Improvment stores, they only sell junk. Before I got those I went through a set of cheapos every 3-4 month and forget getting them sharp again. I bought my first Felco’s 4 years ago, got the sharpening tool and never looked back.
customer_reviews.author: nadanix

customer_reviews.title: Gardener’s Dream Tool
customer_reviews.text: I received this tool as a gift from my son, and liked it so much, I gave one to a dear friend. This is a gardener’s dream tool. It fits your hand just right, with a spring that is manageable and not too tight. REALLY sharp, so Be Careful when you use it! This is a heirloom tool, one that you would pass along to keep in the family! A+ product!
customer_reviews.author: Roger Cat

customer_reviews.title: Not anvil pruners
customer_reviews.text: Both Amazon and the Falcons website described these pruners as anvil style pruners. Not so they are bypass style pruners, the upper blade passes the lower blade instead of meeting it (the anvil). Great if you want bypass pruners, useless if you want anvil pruners. Amazon needs to quit wasting my time. Sending them back.
customer_reviews.author: helen scheerens

customer_reviews.title: You would think these are Chinese...as in no quality control.
customer_reviews.text: The locking mechanism will hardly budge for me and there is no way that a retired aged women would have the strength to move the lever. Dont even think about using a screw driver because the metal is too soft.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal Pruners
customer_reviews.text: I did a LOT of research before I bought these pruners. The ratings were very high, so I forked out the extra money and purchased them. The first time that I used them I was blown away by how well they cut, and how they don't hurt my hand. I was cutting ivy off some of my trees and this nipped through some vines that were 3/4" in diameter. These were stout, hard vines. Do yourself a favor...pay extra for a pair of pruners. It'll make those jobs a lot easier!
customer_reviews.author: Texas Talker

customer_reviews.title: Good Investment
customer_reviews.text: After many years of use thought I would write a review. These are the best pruners I have ever owned. I use them to the point of abuse and they keep cutting and making clean cuts. They do need to be sharpened on occasion but they come apart and go back together really easy. There are a lot of online sites that have instruction and give advise on sharpening which requires disassembly if you don't want to ruin them..
customer_reviews.author: William Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Ferrari of pruning shears; stunt on your neighbors
customer_reviews.text: This is the Ferrari of pruning shears. I have another by Fiskars that I thought was decent, but these shears put them to shame. The action is silky smooth. This is functional art. Seems like a stretch but you’ll know what I mean the first time you use them. Also, these are made for people with small hands; I’m a very large dude and while my hands are slightly too large, it’s not a problem at all. Totally worth getting these still.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Felco - the Gold Standard in Pruners
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement - or supplement to - my 20-year-old #13. I could have just bought a new blade for the old one - and probably will eventually. Properly cared for, Felco lasts forever. The #13 is for heavier branches on shrubs than a #2 can handle. Don't abuse it, though. For thicker branches I use the Felco Folding Saw. I expect my tool bag of Felco Pruners to last several more decades.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne M. Derringer

customer_reviews.title: The best pruner
customer_reviews.text: Cuts cleanly and feels perfect in my medium-large hands. Will last as long as you want with proper maintenance (sharpening and oiling when needed). I also have the No 2s which are the same, but have a riveted blade instead of a blade fastened with screws. The screws are a big improvement since it will make blade replacement MUCH easier and faster (if ever needed). Because of this, I recommend the 11s over the 2s.
customer_reviews.author: atsai

customer_reviews.title: The Best Pruners
customer_reviews.text: Living in south Texas I end up pruning shrubs and trees pretty much year round. I got tired of buying a new pair of pruners every year so decided to splurge on these. I am glad I did. I use the F6 pruners to cut anything up to about 3/4" and use a hand saw or lopper on anything larger. Smooth and easy cuts. I am a male 5' 11" with medium size hand and these fit me perfectly. May end up buying the F2 pruners too as my wife has has her eyes on these and once she starts using them I'll never be able to find them.
customer_reviews.author: S. V. Metre

customer_reviews.title: Rusty
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed with this product. Completely rusted out (yes, I properly clean after use and store in appropriate area) and in one Spring/Summer use the blade is so dull. My husband has pruners that cost much less and his can cut through a finger after 2 years. THIS IS A REAL REVIEW!!! I am not a robot or hired by the company to make ratings go up.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: A must have for Landscapers and Home Owners!!
customer_reviews.text: This is EXACTLY as described. This is my side kick at work. Sharp, durable! To anyone looking at this product, this is the dream shears for trimming!! We sell these at our Nursery, but I decided to buy on here due to the price and I am not disappointed at all! I have tried many other shears, but nothing beats these anvil shears. One thing to keep in mind: The parts are replaceable, the spring, the anvil, the lock! You can order replacements for an excellent price. Felco is such excellent quality. I am happy after 2 years in landscaping, i finally own my own instead of borrowing others
customer_reviews.author: Kenny W.

customer_reviews.title: Great pruners!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best pruners, especially if you are a woman! They are smaller in size and the swivel hand is easier on your muscles and joints. I've had carpal tunnel surgery and other pruners really cause pain. These are the best! Great quality too1
customer_reviews.author: LET

customer_reviews.title: There is nothing else even close
customer_reviews.text: These pruners are perfect. Sharp, well made, I ordered a second pair since we been fighting who gets to use them in the yard. FGorget all the stuff you can buy in the Home Improvment stores, they only sell junk. Before I got those I went through a set of cheapos every 3-4 month and forget getting them sharp again. I bought my first Felco’s 4 years ago, got the sharpening tool and never looked back.
customer_reviews.author: nadanix

customer_reviews.title: Immediately rusts after a single use
customer_reviews.text: I used this once and cleaned it with water and kept aside. In few hours I noticed that pruner had rust on it. Not good for such an expensive and well named pruner.
customer_reviews.author: VasuC

customer_reviews.title: Precision, razor sharp, and quality all in one
customer_reviews.text: If you enjoy using quality, functionally perfect, and ergonomically designed tools, then you will enjoy these pruning shears, Swiss Made. I usually only buy products made in the USA, because i want to support our economy, but when I find a product made by one of our international allies, that are the best of breed (like German Porsche and Audi automobiles or Swiss Rolex watches) I will give it a go. Just like Rolex is at the top of the wristwatch heap, these Swiss made shears live up to their reputation.
customer_reviews.author: OrangeOkie

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: My fisker nippers broke (one of the metal blades just fell off) and I was looking for a replacement when I found these. I LOVE my Felco pruners, I’ve had them for years, so I bought these. The price difference between replacing what I had that broke and these was around $10, I know these will last. I know I won’t be replacing them in 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: K. Means

customer_reviews.title: this actually feels pretty comfortable to use with one hand
customer_reviews.text: This is billed as a "two hand" clipper, but for someone with XL size hands (like me), this actually feels pretty comfortable to use with one hand. It also fits - albeit just barely and with the handles sticking up over your belt by a few inches - in the standard Felco leather pouch. I like that the blades open wider than the regular sizes, for the occasional 1" branch. I wouldn't make a habit of larger-diameter cuts though: given the option, I'd use a bigger lopper with longer handles for better leverage. All in all though, these are extremely good quality, my kids may well be inheriting them one day.
customer_reviews.author: Murphy Shea

customer_reviews.title: Best Pruner By Far
customer_reviews.text: We wouldn't waste money on any other brand of hand pruner. Once you use the Felco, that will be the end of the search. We still have our first Felco- F 8- after 7 years and it is still going strong. I purchased this F-12 as a gift. We have tossed more crappy pruners than I can count. I would say we are heavy pruner users and serious gardeners. It says it is made for smaller hands but my husband's hands are large and he loves it as much as I do.
customer_reviews.author: Housecharmer

customer_reviews.title: Outdoorsmen’s choice
customer_reviews.text: Do you prune things? Get these pruners. Do you have a job that requires you to prune things? Get these pruners. These pruners are the best. A little pricey, but definitely worth it. Fiskars and Corona brand pruners are nothing compared to these. You know immediately where your money goes when you make that first cut. Felco for life, dawg.
customer_reviews.author: Team Valor

customer_reviews.title: Quality pruners
customer_reviews.text: I forgot how nice Felco’s are until I bought another pair. I’ve been experimenting with ARS and other high rated Japanese pruners over the past few years and I must admit these Felco’s feel much better. ARS pruners are definitely quality pruners and do have some features Felco could copy for instance the ARS spring and locking mechanism. Both brands cut well and are made of quality metals but, these Felco’s have them beat on ergonomics. I’m pretty bad about losing pruners so I’ve had many different ones over the years and these #11’s are my favorite, as of today.
customer_reviews.author: katie tarr

customer_reviews.title: Great product but I'm not used to the rotating handle yet.
customer_reviews.text: I got these pruners just the other day, so some of my concerns may be that I am just not used to the rotating handle. It feels unwieldy to me right now, but I h ave only used once or twice and I may not have the hang of it yet. The pruner itself is sharp and effective. Like all Felco products, replacements parts are available. Very high quality pruners and garden hand tools. Go Felco or go home! Just a little unsure if I will like the rotating handle on this one.
customer_reviews.author: pudgy'smom

customer_reviews.title: F-2 size are a good size for most hands
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of reviews and some said the S-2 size wasn’t for women’s small hands. I disagree, these are really comfortable for me and I think my husband could use them also. My hands are average or a little smaller than average female hands and these clippers are very comfortable to use. They feel really well made also.
customer_reviews.author: M G

customer_reviews.title: Return policy not honored
customer_reviews.text: Returned as did not fit hand - way too small - returned in original condition (new, not used at all). They maintained not returned in new condition and refunded 50% .
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Buy once, cry once
customer_reviews.text: I definitely splurged on these but they are awesome. The fit and finish of the parts are great. I've only used mine for a few weeks but my housemate is a professional gardener and she has used hers every day for years and they look almost as pristine as mine. These will definitely last if you take care of them.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Schwartzel

customer_reviews.title: Lost that loving feeling.
customer_reviews.text: Looking forward to typical felco quality having used and loved #2 for decades. Certainly lightweight but therefore a little cheap feeling. the lock lever works as it should but it’s a little too simple. All stamped steel and molded plastic. All in all, I’m sure fine and good value. Just wish they felt a little better in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: grumpy

customer_reviews.title: 50$ for previously owned rust
customer_reviews.text: Just opened ... packaging. Some rust already. I’m 5.3. Holds nicely. Could be a tad smaller sense that’s something judged but not a worry here. 50$ for possibly previously owned rust already. COME ON PEOPLE.
customer_reviews.author: Public name here

customer_reviews.title: Bottom line - excellent pruners!
customer_reviews.text: I bought about 4 pair of pruners - returned them all. I am a senior with small weak hands and tried the ratcheting pruners and pruners for small hands. They just did not do the job of cutting through tough, fibrous desert plant stalks. These are the best I've found! Although they are not for small, weak hands, the wide aperture opening and the ability to use 2 hands does the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Dwyer

customer_reviews.title: Started to Rust after first use
customer_reviews.text: These started to rust after first use. My first pair of Felco's, is this normal??? I have several pairs of cheap pruners....no rust.
customer_reviews.author: Tina B.

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced compared to competitors.
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought one of the similar $25 clippers available at Amazon, these are not worth $50. Simple dipped Plastisol PVC coating on handles is thin, plastic locking mechanism is typical and hard on the thumb. It cuts well, but nothing special -- a trimmer at half the price would do as well. I deluded myself reading all of the wonderful reviews. Not so wonderful. Better than a Fiskers at Home Depot of course, but not twice-the-prices better!
customer_reviews.author: Sinclair Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Good cutting! Handle starting to peal.
customer_reviews.text: Only problem with this item is that the driver did not give the item to the resident since no one was home when it was dropped off at the front door. Front door camera showed they just dropped the package, took a picture then she left. No contact with anyone. The plastic on one of the handles is splitting and starting pealing from the handle. Much more and I will have to return them for a refund. Will try using them some more before deciding. Update: plastic is pealing more and I will be returning them for a full refund. Expected more out of these pruning shears.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Great pruning shears for larger hands, and even medium hands!
customer_reviews.text: These are a great tool. True these are not for small hands. I have medium-size hands and I used them all weekend without issue. When I cut a large branch, I used both hands. I guess this is how they are advertised to me used. They cut with ease compare to my tired Corona shears. A bit more expensive but if you do a lot of hand pruning, they are well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Finally a professional grade pruner
customer_reviews.text: Over the years I have bought many consumer grade pruners from big box stores. I have never been very satisfied with them. They would last about a year before becoming frustrating to use. My yard service manager told me about these clippers as they are the only brand they use. These are higher quality and I expect them to last quite a few years.
customer_reviews.author: David Russell Hill

customer_reviews.title: Felco is best
customer_reviews.text: I have been cutting trails in the forest, so I use shears a lot. I've tried half a dozen brands and I like Felco the best. Being able to replace the cutting edges is important. My only warning is to be sure you don't buy the left hand (or right hand) version by accident as I did the first time I bought a pair. The left handed version is OK, but a little awkward for a righty.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas J McCormick

customer_reviews.title: Great precision pruners
customer_reviews.text: I love these pruners. My previous love was the Felco 7, but upon borrowing a rotating handle version of these during a grape pruning demonstration, I was like, what have I been missing? I don’t miss the rotating handle with these, they fit nicely, with gloves. As a gentleman, I won’t say these are only for “small hands”— the hands of an artist it’s also been said of mine—and well suited to the art of winegrape pruning this is.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I went back & forth on which type of Felcos to get & I am so happy I picked these! I am female with small hands (typically wear a medium size glove and have room in some of the fingertips). These fit perfectly! I love the rotating handle - it did take an afternoon to get used to, but by far the best pruning experience I've ever had - super comfy. Even though they are a bit pricey, I think they are totally worth it and I'm considering a second pair to have as a spare.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mixed Feelings
customer_reviews.text: These shears are well made and cut well, but they open too wide making them somewhat uncomfortable to use. I'm a 6' man so I wonder whether they would be able to be used by someone smaller than I. I kept them, but if I ever need another pair of shears I will look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Benozzo

customer_reviews.title: Locking safety mechanism was seized
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a quality set of sharp pruning shears with a comfortable handle and ordered these based upon the numerous positive reviews. Unfortunately, the safety locking mechanism was seized and impossible to rotate, so I returned them to Amazon and requested another pair. The second pair arrived quickly, but had the same problem and were returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Silveradosue

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: This product purchased from Amazon functioned like I expected from a Felco, except the blade did not stay sharp. So, I replaced the blade (also available on Amazon). When we "lost" (misplaced, etc) and I went to purchase a new one, I inquired from Felco where to purchase. Their response included the following: "... beware of AMAZON as well. Many of our customers are enticed by the free shipping but receive a counterfeit FELCO." I don't know what to make of this.
customer_reviews.author: Marthaman

customer_reviews.title: My go-to choice for day to day harvesting and trimming
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this model of Felco snips for several years, and they are my go-to for most things in the garden and on the farm. I use them often for harvesting and pruning small diameter stems and sprigs. There are times when the big crescent-bladed pruners are overkill, as lovely as they are. Keep these dry and sharpened, and they will last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Moonlit Kale

customer_reviews.title: Felco F-31 anvil shears
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent, well made and comfortable to use. Easy cutting for my 70+ yo hands. Works well on dried vines. My time is limited in the garden and I like to get as much done and quickly as possible. Better than by-pass as the vines and shrubs do not get caught between the cross cutting blades. Have other anvil types and these are the best (and most expensive).
customer_reviews.author: RAndy R.

customer_reviews.title: A FAVORITE tool
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my Felco snips. I owned one and then I owned TWO so my daughter and I could each have one when snipping bushes and unruly plants. This is a favorite tool - right up there with a soft #2 pencil that has a good eraser. It is a must have - basic equipment for gardening and yard work. This model Felco F-4 Classic Manual Pruning Shears fits my hands ( small older woman) and I have purchased this replacement only because one pair fell into the storm drain.
customer_reviews.author: perfume searcher

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for anyone with a garden
customer_reviews.text: Cuts through the ivy roots easily. Still sharp after several full-day uses. The blade, however, changed its color and is now in black spots. I bought it after reading the review for similar shears on Wirecutter, but their testing methods and thoroughness are far from scientific or exhaustive. Home Depot has many models half the price with titanium blades, is an additional $$ worth it - I don't know.
customer_reviews.author: Sergei Mutovkin

customer_reviews.title: house plants, flowers, even small branches!
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying, these are my favorite pruning shears for my house plants and for pruning roses and things of that nature. Unfortunately, I don't typically wear gloves when operating these so the plastic handles are very slippery on hands. I bought an inexpensive roll of batting grip tape and covered the handles and they are now the coolest shears! Perfect for what I need them for. Very sturdy build! Felco is the only brand to buy for the avid pruner
customer_reviews.author: ginger_punk

customer_reviews.title: yes and no
customer_reviews.text: I basically like it. It cuts well, but, the mechanism on this particular one was faulty from the start in that, even after using appropriate lubricant, it did not spring back open on it's own. I would get it again in case it is a fluke,.but if the next one would do the same, I would give it only 1 star and shop elsewhere. Since it probably will last for years, we won't know about that any time soon :) This particular one did not live up to my expectation.
customer_reviews.author: Christiane Wolters

customer_reviews.title: Extremely high quality and will last forever!
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of hand shears that look similar but there is only one Felco! There are different versions of Felcos but if you're a professional gardener like myself, these Felco 2's will be the ones you want. The handle is perfect. It comes with a little tool to change out parts and replace blades. Swiss made so you can never go wrong. You will never need another pair of hand shears ever again
customer_reviews.author: Fausto Uriguen

customer_reviews.title: Handy sharp pruners
customer_reviews.text: Have a pair of Fiskars prunes. However, while cutting, small twigs would get jam between the blades. Decided to get a new pair of prunes. These pruners are very comfortable in hand. I prefer their smooth grip cover over the rough one on the Fiskars. Granted these pruners are fairly new, but they are very sharp and cut cleanly and effortlessly. Well made and like the fact that they can be disassembled for maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: great quality, a must have for your garden bag.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't going to buy these cuz they seemed a little expensive, but a friend bought them and gave them to me, and they're really good quality. They're nice and heavy weight, and cook thick tomato branches and squash Vines effortlessly. If you're on the fence about these due to price, they're worth every penny. I have some Fiskars clippers (they were cheaper at a big box store), but I would reach for these over them any day.
customer_reviews.author: surfgirlt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Shears
customer_reviews.text: Second pair of these I have purchased. These are the best shears we have ever used. This model is designed for smaller hands and my wife really likes them. I have larger hands and these work well for me as well. The blades maintain their sharpness for a long period of time. I have only touched up the initial pair once in about a year and a half. If you are considering buying cheaper pair, spend the extra money and buy these.
customer_reviews.author: SMS

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shears! Cut great, easy to use, very comfortable. Worth the money but they took forever to come in!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn B Racca

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Felcos, 'nuff said. It's these, or Japanese, for me, these are light years beyond any Corona or Fiskars product.
customer_reviews.author: Nakmuay

customer_reviews.title: These shears worked OK except for one nuisance. The ...
customer_reviews.text: These shears worked OK except for one nuisance. The shears constantly stick closed after cutting anything with a little moisture in it. The spring is way too light. Felco should check out the Carona shears and the spring that they use; I almost never have that problem with my Coronas
customer_reviews.author: porkchop36

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, cuts well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my dad, but must sheepishly admit I use it more than he does. I wanted to replace his old hand cutters he uses in the back yard, with the requirement they cut at least 1” diameter and be easy to use for a senior citizen. These really do a great job. They cut 1” and more (if the wood is on the softer side, like crepe myrtles). They have stayed sharp. They are easy to hold and press, even for his older hands. This quality was exactly what I wanted for him, and the price/value is great.
customer_reviews.author: Cedarcan

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: While this pruner does cut thin branches with ease, it struggles on any branches over 1/2" thick. I have a much less expensive knock-off pruner that cuts much better and looks almost identical to the Felco. It also has the same feel as the Felco's. I would recommend you save money and buy a highly rated much less expensive pruner over this over priced pruner.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Orsucci

customer_reviews.title: somewhat underwhelmed
customer_reviews.text: For the $50 price I think I'll look elsewhere, perhaps at one of this brands other models. I bought these because they were recommended for a woman's hand span. Are these better than my under $20 Fiskars bypass pruners? Yes. Do these allow me to cut mullein weed in the field for an hour without raising the beginnings of a thumb blister? No. Do these allow me to cut 1/2" woody mullein weed at ground level? Absolutely not :(
customer_reviews.author: urkiddingme?

customer_reviews.title: Best pruning shears I have owned, though a bit pricey
customer_reviews.text: I have avoided Felco pruners for years and stayed with Corona shears because of price. I still think they are over priced, but they are truly superior to my next favorite, Corona pruning shears. If you just like the best, work as a gardener, landscaper or an orchard; spend the extra and get these Felco shears. They are awesome! If you want a great occasional use pruning shear, and you are price sensitive, look at the Corona shears or the Felco knock-off shears at Costco. BTW, the Costco shears look exactly like Felco, but I tried them and there is no comparison.
customer_reviews.author: bobwhitebarry

customer_reviews.title: Seems these are Not Real Felco pruners.
customer_reviews.text: This was a piece of trash. My second pair. The first pair I owned was highly treasured and was stolen. I swear these don't seem to be authentic felcos. The red rubber on the handle stretched out and began to shift and the closing mechanism constantly jams against the screw on the opposite side during pruning.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Rust!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these clippers because of their reputation for cutting and reviews by other customers. I was amazed at just how quickly the blades rusted! I typically use these to trim back bushes, small trees, and plants. I would have thought that the blades would have been better treated. I am keeping them but disappointed in the product quality and would like to hear from the vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly DuBreuil

customer_reviews.title: Best Shears Ever
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing at lest five "economical" brands I finally broke down and purchased these for my wife - she had been constantly using my pair which meant I had to use her junkie ones. Problem solved, she loves the new shears and has not once used mine. The slightly smaller size fits her hand perfectly. Save yourself some money and get these from the get go.
customer_reviews.author: WBG

customer_reviews.title: seem to be good
customer_reviews.text: i looked at the reviews on the pruners on the market today and bought 2 pair of these one for my husband who is left handed and one for myself. i like how sharp they are and the fact that you can get replacement parts. they are expensive but if they last 5 years then they are as cheap as any of the cheap ones but i sure hope they hold up on my 30 tree orchard for many years , hopefully for 10 to 15 but that remains to be seen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: no returns after one (1) month, even if product is defective!
customer_reviews.text: This was my second purchase of this product. I have and still use it, although the blade is getting dull. I purchased the second one as backup and for my wife to use. It has been used sparingly. My wife complained she couldn't squeeze the grip together. I tried it and found the locking nut tightens when used. I tried to back off the nut slightly. This made it work again, but only briefly. Then it bound up again. Very disappointed that a defective product sold by Amazon Prime isn't allowed to be returned or warrantied.
customer_reviews.author: Chad M.

customer_reviews.title: Quality and great cutting. Not for a smaller hands.
customer_reviews.text: This was a long awaited gift to myself. The Felco F-12 are not for small hands they do cut well and a smooth clean cut. To cut the branch in the middle of the blade the pruners open wide and I do have great difficulty to pull the handles together to cut. They are of quality and do have some weight to them. I am not sure what I am going to do.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Best pruners ever!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best and most comfortable hand pruners I have ever used. This size is actually for someone with smaller hands but my husband has used them with no problem also. There is no cramping in your hand or fatigue. They are sharp and it does not take a lot of effort to use. I have arthritis in my hands and I don't hesitate to use these. I did hesitate initially on purchasing them because they were more expensive than most but they have been worth it. They are NOT made in China. I think they are Swiss made.
customer_reviews.author: Momlette

customer_reviews.title: Sharp but hard to hold
customer_reviews.text: Must have been designed by a guy with huge hands. Product is nice and sharp but lousy to hold for long if you have average size hands. It spreads way to wide apart. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dandygal

customer_reviews.title: Great for smaller hands and arthritis
customer_reviews.text: I've loved my F-6's for many years and when I read there was an ergonomic version in the F-12, I thought I'd give it a try. It's a game changer for me. With hand arthritis, these pruners cause less fatigue and more productivity. After changing the blades in my 20 year old F-6's, I sent them to my daughter. She absolutely loves them! Every part can be replaced in Felco pruners, so they can last a lifetime...so refreshing to see a company that believes in their products!
customer_reviews.author: B Ray

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice!
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of Felco, I needed really good pruners, I like the rotating handle. I did some marathon pruning and my hand was not really sore. My hands are medium sized female. Very sharp and easy to use, I was previously using the Fiskars with the rotating handle. They seem to be well made, hope they perform as well as reviews say for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: CatLady

customer_reviews.title: Sharp as hell!
customer_reviews.text: These are fabulous and feel great in your hand. The red grip helps hold onto them. BEWARE---I wasn't using good safety while wiping my blade dry after trimming some wet shrubs. It sliced the tip of my finger a good one. I'm so glad I invested in them. The $12 Fiskars cutters I previously had rusted and didn't make sharp cuts. I'll never buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor AVB

customer_reviews.title: Quality Shears
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality pruning shears that will last forever. The blade is very sharp and they are effortless to use. I have never had a Felco product that has disappointed me. Buy quality the first time and avoid disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Stan C.

customer_reviews.title: Sharp!
customer_reviews.text: I just received these garden snips last week, but after the 1st use I threw away 7 pairs-- I have been trying to find a pair that does a good job of cutting plants and flowers for years. At this time I LOVE these. I'll follow up if I change my mind ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Athena

customer_reviews.title: Cuts like butter
customer_reviews.text: I'm aware that anything can be made sharp, at least for a little while, but I've used these pruners for about a week now, and the steel on the blade still bites into a fingernail. Otherwise very ergonomic, sturdy, and should I mention classy-looking. You could buy two $25 pruners, or you could buy one $50 pruner that's twice as good, to each their own.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Just Recently Discovered
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the Felco #2 for years, but just recently heard about the #14 for smaller hands. So love the fit and the ability to cut and not have it flop out of my hands. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Lin C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'11 and 160 lbs. These fit my hands and are amazing to use. Before these I had only used cheap ones from Walmart. Definitely worth the price, makes them much more enjoyable to use.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Neat little useful gadget for tight spaces
customer_reviews.text: Just received this and tested it out immediately on some green beans in the garden. Simply perfect. The narrow nose allows for very precise cutting in tight spaces — something that was simply not possible with a traditional pruner and something that was causing me all sorts of grief. Could not be more pleased. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: RagTag

customer_reviews.title: Super high quality tool
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the cost; i would not get a cheaper look-a-like. Make sure you get Felco, they stand behind their products, and they use high quality steel and i don't think you will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Bons

customer_reviews.title: Really work well
customer_reviews.text: These pruners are more heavy duty than the usual pair of small, handheld snips. They are well made and the blades are substantial, hence they cut much, much easier and better than my older pairs (including Fiskers). Highly recommend springing for the small increase in cost over other pruners and buy these; you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Lightfoot

customer_reviews.title: A Gardeners Must
customer_reviews.text: I recommend these pruners over any other brand. I took them to Uruguay with me when I started a passion fruit project. I also bought a leather holder to keep them in that keeps them dry and rust free. These pruners are the strongest and hold up over time. Well forged all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: Odvaha

customer_reviews.title: A truly useful tool for lefties who prune roses.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use in awkward positions -- when reaching deep into rose bushes for pruning. I'm not sure exactly what the rotating handle does, just that the pruner works no matter my hand position (e.g., when I have to turn or twist my hand to get at the right angle for the cut), it cuts well and doesn't irritate my wrist. I've used a number of left-handed pruners, but this is the very best I've ever had. I do not have really good hand strenght, but it cuts easily and I am not experiencing hand fatigue. Excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Made cutting a lot easier. I wanted to multiple my lucky bamboo and this worked like a charm. With the cushion handle it was very comfortable to hold considering I have a weaker right hand. My hand size is about 6inches, so before buying make sure you get the right one, the label on the pruner has hand size specific. The ones I got were made in Switzerland. I highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: bhat01

customer_reviews.title: Not any better than a $15 dollar pair.
customer_reviews.text: I thought that because of the price that I would get a pair of pruner's that exceeded my expectations and worked better and lasted longer than other pruners I've purchased. I was wrong. I've been using the pruners for 2 months and now the blades consistently stick together even though I wash them. The catch that keeps them closed is hard to move. They are definitely not worth the price. Go to a hardware store and get a $15 pair. You'll feel better.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Ewen

customer_reviews.title: Great for small hands
customer_reviews.text: I am under 5 ft tall and sometimes I have a hard time getting my hand around shears' handles. Gardening can be difficult on my hands. This solved a big problem. I can easily use these to trim succulents and dried stems from a bird of paradise plants. I'm very happy with these shears.
customer_reviews.author: SifusWoman

customer_reviews.title: Won't cut
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these new after seeing a pair a friend had. Theirs cut good,but this pair doesn't even seem sharp--difficult to cut anything. Package had been opened when I received it, and perhaps they were defective and had been returned. Problem is they were a gift and return window had passed when I received them. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: NC Buyer

customer_reviews.title: These Anvil style pruners are Great.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent anvil style pruners. We also bough the model F-2 bypass pruner for my wife. Most folks prefer the bypass style but I have always had better luck with anvil style pruners holding up years longer than bypass style. But then, i always had cheaper brands, these are my first Felcos and I actually like both styles made by Felco. But I still pick up these anvil F-31s when I have to prune something.
customer_reviews.author: SNBow

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: I have been gardening most of my life and have used lots of different pruners. Felcos are definitely the best and worth the price! I've also used different Felco models and always come back to #2. I've had some pairs for over 10 years and with occasional maintenance they work great. Now, if I could just keep from occasionally losing them....
customer_reviews.author: T. H. Flowers

customer_reviews.title: Unusable After A Few Months
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these based on the excellent reviews, but after a season of light usage, they are so rusty as to render them useless—almost impossible to even open. I should note, these are stored in a cabinet after each usage—never left out. Even my old junky Caronas operate better.
customer_reviews.author: A.H.

customer_reviews.title: Got a 2nd pair
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd pair of Felco 300s, I needed a second pair to keep by my house plants in the kitchen. They're great, and pretty cheap for the Felco brand! They're just a little more expensive than fiscars or whatever they sell at the hardware store, so why not get the good ones for a couple more dollars?
customer_reviews.author: Scott S.

customer_reviews.title: Good size for my hand.
customer_reviews.text: I am a 62 yr old female with medium size hands. Love these pruners. Fits easily in my hand. Blades are sharp. I bought a sharpening stone for future maintenance. Much better than the Fisker pruning shears I had been buying. This is now one of my favorite yard tools.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this primarily for my wife's use, and it fits her hand well. After 6 months of moderate use, the blades remain sharp, and cut very cleanly.
customer_reviews.author: corvid49

customer_reviews.title: Rotating handle - of sketchy benefit
customer_reviews.text: I find the rotating handle distracting, and whatever leverage improvement it gives is offset by the vagueness of the feel. Also shipped from factory sticky - I had to adjust so it opens properly. All in all, I think I prefer my old Felco #9 better, and it was less expensive. If some of the parts hadn't loosened and fallen off in a hedge of nasty blackberries, and the replacement parts not taken so long to get here, I could have skipped the F-10 and been just as happy.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Einstein

customer_reviews.title: The BEST for Pruning Roses!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these Pruners to replace an identical pair that’s 20 years old. The quality is still quite good and they are made in Switzerland. I gave my old pair to my husband as he finally lost his pair of Corona pruners. These are the absolute best for pruning roses!
customer_reviews.author: J. Lingo

customer_reviews.title: Everyday maintenance favorite
customer_reviews.text: These are great for basic deadheading, harvesting vegetables, cutting flowers and shaping. They are easy to open and close with one hand and the red color makes them stand out if you let them sit. The slim blades make it easy to get to the base of a stem or vegetable without cutting leaves or other stems. Sharp and strong enough to cut small branches on shrubs if need be. A great choice for everyday garden maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Great Pruner
customer_reviews.text: It is expensive, but the cheaper ones I have had breaks easily and often gets branches caught between the blades gap rather than cutting through. I have used Felco for about a month, cutting branches are a breeze. I can cut through maybe 3/4 in, but that's really the limit of my grip strength.
customer_reviews.author: Chase Z

customer_reviews.title: Felco Professional Hand Pruning Shears
customer_reviews.text: Was given my first pair of Felco #2 in the mid 70's by an old girlfriend...still have them! I needed hand pruners for some employees and didn't even consider any other brands. Felco is by far the best hand pruning shear one could own. Truly the choice of professionals. When I see someone carrying a pair whatever the model number I know the person understands the value of the product for their investment. Never buy cheap tools to get the job done right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Invest in the best
customer_reviews.text: When buying pruners, always buy the best! Felco's have been around all my 50 gardening years. Must say though, Japanese made tools are also excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret A Mayer

customer_reviews.title: why did i have to be 75 years old to buy this?
customer_reviews.text: I'v bought every pair of cheap clippers ever made over the past 53 years. One of them was almost satisfactory. These are actually good: brisk, strong cutters, with replaceable blades bo less. comfortable to operate. There is nothing about these not to like.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh Foster

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, Top Quality, Perfect Pruners
customer_reviews.text: Bought these a few months ago to prune flowers, small plants and bushes. These pruners are fantastic and I love using them. They're definitely a hard core precision tool and super sharp ... these suckers would snip off the end of a finger in a second so be careful !!!
customer_reviews.author: jr12345

customer_reviews.title: Sticky
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get a nice pair of felco trimming snips for quick deadheading and flower snipping. They worked great the first few uses, but now they stick a lot for some reason making it too slow going. They will stick nearly every time. I've tried adjusting them and cleaning them. Not sure what the deal is. Funny thing is, is just before buying these I saw another review saying the same thing and although I didn't own a pair I commented telling them they must be doing something wrong or they got a bad pair. Apparently it must not be as unusual as I thought. I would not spend the 20 dollars on these again.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Paulson

product_meta.title: Felco F-2 068780 Classic Manual Hand Pruner, F 2
product_meta.description:
Style:F 2| Pattern Name:PrunerFalco Original Pruner With 1 Inch Cutting Capacity 8.25in Solid forged metal alloy handles. Replaceable cutting blade. Anvil blade with a sap groove. A hardened bolt and nut to assure exact adjustment of both the cutting and anvil blades. Rubber cushion and shock absorber. Compatible products with FELCO 2: FELCO 902, FELCO 903, FELCO 910, FELCO 910+, FELCO 912, FELCO 980, FELCO 990.

AMAZON.COM
These classic Felco pruners set the standard by which all others are judged. The choice of landscape professionals, nursery workers, and savvy gardeners around the globe; this exceptionally well-made tool features a design that's been unchanged for more than 50 years. The anvil blade has a deep sap groove to prevent sticking. A Swiss, precision-made cutting blade with soft wire cutter is replaceable for maximum return on investment. An easily-adjusted bolt and nut allow users to customize blade alignment for more efficient operation. A rubber cushion with shock absorbers pads blades where they come together to reduce impact and strain on wrists. Strong, light, forged-aluminum alloy handles have a red, plastic coating that's molded for comfort (and makes pruners easier to spot in the garden). A non-corroding spring mechanism is covered with a metal sheath to protect from moisture. 

 Ideal for trimming rose bushes and woody perennials, the Felco Original's smooth, soft action, ergonomic comfort, and exceptional durability put it in a class of its own. It's covered by a one-year warranty. However, with proper care, these pruners will last a lifetime. --Mary Park
feature_bullets: Anvil blade with a sap groove
A hardened bolt and nut to assure exact adjustment of both the cutting and anvil blades
Ideal pruner for light applications and easily adjustable
Features strong blades with a wire cutting notch
Blades are made of high-quality hardened steel

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars6,033 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
